topic.name: English Grammar - Conditionals Mastery Test
topic.description: Advanced questions covering all types of English conditionals for C1 level mastery

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses the zero conditional?

options.text: If you heat water to 100째C, it boils.
If you heat water to 100째C, it will boil.
If you heated water to 100째C, it would boil.
If you heat water to 100째C, it boiled.

questions.question_text: Identify the correct first conditional sentence:

options.text: If it rains tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic.
If it rained tomorrow, we cancel the picnic.
If it rains tomorrow, we cancel the picnic.
If it will rain tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic.

questions.question_text: Choose the sentence that uses the second conditional correctly:

options.text: If I won the lottery, I would travel the world.
If I win the lottery, I would travel the world.
If I won the lottery, I will travel the world.
If I would win the lottery, I would travel the world.

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses the third conditional?

options.text: If she had studied harder, she would have passed the exam.
If she studied harder, she would pass the exam.
If she would have studied harder, she passed the exam.
If she had studied harder, she will have passed the exam.

questions.question_text: Select the sentence that correctly combines the second and third conditionals:

options.text: If I had known, I would be there now.
If I knew, I would have been there.
If I would have known, I would be there now.
If I had known, I would have been there.

questions.question_text: Which sentence expresses a real possibility using the mixed conditional?

options.text: If she were more confident, she would have accepted the job.
If she had accepted the job, she would be more confident now.
If she accepts the job, she would be confident now.
If she were accepting the job, she would have been confident.

questions.question_text: Choose the correct sentence using the inverted conditional form:

options.text: Had I known, I would have helped you.
If I had known, I would have helped you.
Had I knew, I would help you.
If I knew, had I helped you.

questions.question_text: Identify the sentence using 'unless' correctly as a conditional substitute:

options.text: I won't go unless it stops raining.
Unless it will stop raining, I won't go.
Unless it stopped raining, I won't go.
I won't go unless it stopped raining.

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses the conditional with 'wish' to express regret?

options.text: I wish I had taken that opportunity.
I wish I take that opportunity.
I wish I will take that opportunity.
I wish I took that opportunity.

questions.question_text: Choose the sentence that correctly uses the future real conditional:

options.text: If they finish early, they will join us for dinner.
If they finished early, they will join us for dinner.
If they finished early, they would join us for dinner.
If they will finish early, they join us for dinner.
